intro: Anchusa linifolia var. kunthii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar medicinal and horticultural uses.
